column1: 激发兴趣，对于专业课的 一开始，我准备不 学习起到重要作用。 足。课前预习不充分，以 而与之最密切相关为老师的教学方法会和 的就是C++。说句心里话，以前的一样，只准备好了 之前我是一点点c++的概“听课”，没有思考，没 念都没有，所以刚开始接有参与讨论。 触时我非常的不知所以
题目很好的结合了课堂所上的知识，印象很深刻关于哈佛大学的解释感觉对重点和细节未来学科的学习规划有了初步认识，We like to say that CS teaches you how to think more methodically and how to solve problems more effectively.  As such
column2: its lessons are applicable well beyond the boundaries of CS itself. But CS is also
column4: the study of information. How do you represent it? With what methods (aka algorithms) can you process it? Perhaps the most liberal answer
column6: is that CS “has no exclusive domain of its own
column7: and that its importance comes from the problems to which it is applied.”

column1: 听了老师的指引，我去了解了一下计算机学科学术界和业界的信息。知道了目前中国计算机科学最强的大学是清华大学，并从参加ACM大赛的学长了解到，目前我校与清华大学的计算机学科的学生的差距。与此同时我也上了微软bing搜索，去查找关于computing science的信息。以下是我搜到的信息 Computer science is the study of the theory
column3: and engineering that form the basis for the design and use ofcomputers. It is the scientific and practical approach to computation and its applications and the systematic study of the feasibility
column6: and mechanization of the methodical procedures (or algorithms) that underlie the acquisition
column11: and access to information. An alternate
column12: more succinct definition of computer science is the study of automating algorithmic processes that scale. A computer scientist specializes in the theory of computation and the design of computational systems.[1] Its fields can be divided into a variety of theoretical and practical disciplines. Some fields
column13: such as computational complexity theory (which explores the fundamental properties of computational and intractable problems)
column15: while fields such as computer graphics emphasize real-world visual applications. Other fields still focus on challenges in implementing computation. For example
column16: programming language theory considers various approaches to the description of computation
column17: while the study of computer programming itself investigates various aspects of the use of programming languageand complex systems. Human–computer interaction considers the challenges in making computers and computations useful
